quoteFirst: Sight-seeing in Santiago naturally begins with the _Plaza_, the center of which is beautified by palm, orange, and fir trees, grass, fountains, and flower beds, among which are broad walks and benches. From the usual band stand Sunday, Thursday, and Saturday evenings concerts of good classical and operatic music are given, in summer from
quoteLast: , in winter from six to seven. In the center of the Plaza is a statue by a famous Italian sculptor, Fagazarro, which represents Liberty breaking the chains of (Spanish) Slavery. The four crocodiles beneath with their mouths open indicate that this was originally intended for a fountain.
title: The South American Tour
author: Peck, Annie S. (Annie Smith), 1850-1935

quoteFirst: The Staff was located in an old two-story building that was much the worse for wear from German calling cards. My "go" was from
quoteLast: Promptly at ten o'clock a rap came to the door and, blowing out the light, I inquired who it was. It was my relief, Dave Evans, one of the best pals whom it has ever been my lot to soldier with.
title: S.O.S. Stand to!
author: Grant, Reginald

quoteFirst: The people in Egyptian cities do not eat their evening meal until from
quoteLast: . The restaurants have their tables in the streets and the people eat and shop at the same time. Watching the people at a large restaurant in Cairo, one night, I wrote down a list of the articles offered for sale while they were eating their evening meal.
title: Birdseye Views of Far Lands
author: Nichols, James T. (James Thomas), 1865-
